subject: Science
title: Fog: Clouds on the Ground
description: One-minute skill: Fog: Clouds on the Ground.

hook.text: Fog is literally a cloud sitting on the ground. Same physics, different altitude.

buildup.text: When the ground cools at night, the air above it can drop below its dew point.

discovery.text: Water vapor condenses into tiny droplets that hang in the air â€” reducing visibility.

twist.text: San Francisco's famous fog is caused by cold ocean water chilling warm air above it.

climax.text: Dense fog causes more road deaths annually than tornadoes or hurricanes in the US.

punchline.text: Fog kills more drivers than tornadoes. The quiet weather is the dangerous one.
